name: Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale at Troon North

reviews.text: What a lovely hotel! This was my second time at the FS Scottsdale and I was delighted. The service was so attentive, especially around the pool. They also have a great selection of fruity cocktails (all of which I tried). The scenery is beautiful with amazing views of Pinnacle peak and others. Location is a bit far off, but it didn't matter to us at all. We will certainly be back!
reviews.title: Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would give this hotel 5 stars in a minute. The place is beautiful and very well maintained. The service overall was also excellent. The only issue during our visit was 100% unprofessional food service. This happened with room service, and in both restaurants. Everyone was very nice but that doesn't make up for sloppy service. It really feels like the food management area is weak. It would take pages to recount the specific issues with each meal. If you are familiar with the David Lynch's films imagine people walking by your table with blank looks, off on mysterious tasks that have nothing to do with the diners ignoring your requests.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel undone by lackluster food service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: www.ourcherishedlife.com
reviews.title: Relaxing Comfortable Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In February, our good friends, Joe and Jewel, joined us on a trip to Scottsdale, Arizona. We stayed at the Four Seasons Residence Club which is right beside the Troon North Golf Course.
reviews.title: love the hotel, underwhelmed by rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really liked our villa which had signs of quality throughout, like wooden shutters, full kitchen, dining room, living room, complimentary L’Occitane En Provence toiletries (we’re suckers for quality freebies!), etc. It was also ideal as they had a shuttle that took us to the golf course for our round where I almost broke a multi-million dollar home with my slice. Service was top notch as one night, when we wanted to use the BBQ grill, front desk asked me when I would like to use it and what tools I required. By the time I got to the grill, it was cleaned and fired up and the cooking utensils I had requested were already waiting for me. As a family resort, there are many amenities and activities (eg. Pool, tennis courts, hiking trails, kids camps, etc.). This place would be a great long-term getaway for a relaxing vacation. The style of this resort reminds me of Mexico, or as I like to call it, “hacienda-style” architecture. Ooh, now I feel like a Corona & some hot weather!
reviews.title: Four Seasons Resorts are always treat their customers with respect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for a relaxing long weekend and had a great time. If you're into rustling and bustling, this is the wrong place for you. It seems like there's nobody around most of the time, unless you go down to the pool (and the place was at capacity!). We got a nice room close to the pool. We had to get our room changed from one of the farther rooms by the self parking-- highly recommended. We didnt play tennis, golf, or visit the free fitness room. We just lounged by the pool and used our rental car to go out and about during the day.
reviews.title: Relax and enjoy... it's a beautiful property with not much to do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really nice place... great people working there-- prepare to be relaxed and def not a place to go drink beers with the boys trying to pick up chicks.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect - would highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommended: The hike up Pinaccle Peak was tougher than we thought it would be but it was well rewarding!
reviews.title: The Standard of Guest Service

reviews.text: We came here for a long weekend getaway to just relax...and we definitely picked the right place. The service is impeccable, the food is terrific - we tried all the resturants and we would recommend them all. We truly enjoyed being served at the pool and we felt as though we were waited on hand and foot, it was perfect. The Talaveria restaurant had a perfect view and the food was outstanding (my husband said the bone-in ribeye was one of the best he has had). There truly isn't an aspect of this resort that isn't perfect!
reviews.title: After a soft remodel and a huge improvement in service, this is once again one of our favorite resorts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing we would do differently is rent a car. It is roughly 30 miles from the airport and a distance from the town. However, they were more than happy to call us a cab and they do have car service available.
reviews.title: Found Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel and the grounds are absolutely lovely. The service is second to none (except for amateur service in their signature restaurant, Talavera). The plantings are incredible. the views are fabulous. The single most comfortable bed I have ever slept on, except for my own. Rooms are wonderful. This place is just terrific. I would never want to stay closer to town, where there is polution and crowding. Not so here at Four Seasons!
reviews.title: Absolutely Unbelievable Experience, Once Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: one of the best hotel i've ever been, wonderful location, just perfect. situated in an elevated position, you have great views over scottsdale, phoenix. beatiful rooms, quite, pool is amazing.
reviews.title: absolute amasing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Scottsdale Four Seasons for an anniversary trip. We appreciated the sparkling wine, strawberries and chocolate that the hotel sent to us in our room. Although this was high season, the resort never felt too crowded. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool in the covered cabanas. Staff members circulated so frequently that we rarely had to get up from our lounge chairs to order our prickly pear margaritas! The first floor room was lovely and comfortable. We enjoyed the private patio overlooking the desert and the gas fireplace in the room. Don't miss having drinks and dinner in the Onyx bar. Incredible view and nice ambience. We made our reservation through American Express Platinum and were pleased with the room upgrade (to Deluxe Casita), snacks in the room, and food and beverage credits.
reviews.title: First class resort

reviews.text: Just got back from the FS Scottsdale. My wife and I travelled with 3 young kids (6, 2 and 9 months) along with a babysitter. We have stayed at numerous luxury resorts but always stay at a FS if it is present in the area of our travel. Actually, we tend to travel a lot of times to destinations that have a FS. In the last 4 years we have done the FS in Maui, Nevis, Carmelo (Uruguay) and now Scottsdale. We also have stayed at other very luxurious non FS resorts and have something to compare to. We are loyal FS customers because of the consistent service, luxurious properties, and the family friendly atmosphere. With that said let me get to a quick review of this place.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing Resort

reviews.text: The grounds are landscaped with exotic desert shrubs/trees and very well maintained. The resort is made up of many small casitas ( 2 story buildings) that blend in with the geography of the area. The lobby is very inviting and colorful with a stunning view of the sonoran desert mountains. The pool area has a nice set up with 3 pools to accomodate toddlers, adults/children, and adults only. The rooms are typical well decorated, clean, rooms with a balcony and a large bathroom with marble vanity.
reviews.title: So realxed I did not want to leave . . .

reviews.text: What can I say? It's the Four Seasons - you're always going to receive impeccable service here - that's what their brand stands for, but my goodness - the rooms were ahhhh-mazing!! Patio area looked right out into the cactus and Sonoran Desert. The in-room fireplace was a warm comfort during the chilly evenings. The food at Crescent Moon could have come from any quality restaurant in the country and that's just the cafe. I was more than satisfied and quite impressed by the property and the staff at the Four Seasons at Troon North.
reviews.title: Amazing scenery, top notch service, perfect for outdoorsy types!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a business function so I wasn't able to take advantage of all of the outdoor activity options, but am looking forward to the opportunity to return. If I had to give any negative points, it would only be due to fact that the place is almost an hour away from Phoenix's airport and almost $75 in cab costs, but it's worth it for the experience and you have GOT to come for the experience.
reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things!!

reviews.text: I took my husband to the Four Seasons in Scottsdale for his 50th. He loves to golf, loves shopping, fine dining, and hot weather, so it seemed like a good idea. The hotel was gorgeous. However, we have stayed at many beautiful resorts before. so what made this special?? Without a doubt, it was the service. Absolutely impeccable but in a friendly way, not in a snooty way. Staff would help us find a good spot by the pool, brought drinks whenever we wanted (never had to wait), gave us good info on shopping etc, and were super friendly. The room was lovely, with a great patio overlooking the pool. The restaurants were all very good, albeit pricey, but that was to be expected. My husband golfed at both courses and spoke highly of them. What I liked best was the proximity to Pinnacle Peak for hiking - right out the back door, a popular, well groomed, difficult but not treachorous hike that was extremely enjoyable. I will definitely go back, next time with the kids.
reviews.title: 10th visit and Never a disappointment
Everything you hope it would be
reviews.text: I went back to FS Scottsdale at Troon for the 10th time over Memorial day weekend. I love this place and would usually not go back to the same hotel over and over. The Four Seasons is worth every visit. The updated pool is great, the seating is better at the pool area there is not a fight for lounge chairs like there can be at some of the FS (Maui)I have been to. They have an adult only pool which is nice…

The rooms are spacious and I always request the same building number, and 6 out of 10 times my request has been granted. I will say that building 7 (I think) with the plunge pool suite was divine. Large bedroom with a big living area a huge patio with fireplace, and the private plunge pool is great and very relaxing. I would disagree with the review that said the pool rooms were great. I find them to be noisy, and love the view of the rooms in the back of the building.( That’s just me)
reviews.title: Worth the splurge

aka: Four Seasons Resort Scottsdale At Troon North Hotel Scottsdale
